title: Workshop on Applying Representative Learning Models for Sports Training Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic sports science concepts and ability to use online learning tools
context.additional_context: Participants, as professionals, require foundational understanding of sports training design and aim to acquire practical models applicable to real educational settings.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three training environments that reflect actual game conditions using representative instructional design principles
Learners can propose at least two evaluation criteria for the representativeness of training scenarios based on data analysis results applying rule-induction algorithms
Learners can collaboratively design and share a set of rules for a soccer kicking training model with peer learners using online collaboration tools
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
